result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Rozerricka N Ruffin

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Nicholas John Conrardy appeared for Rozerricka N Ruffin.  Attorney Alexander James Geocaris appeared for State of Wisconsin. 
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE. Case in court for status conference.  Court in trial on another matter.  Defense requests another status date.  Court set date as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.
Status conference scheduled for November 30, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed:  Pretrial Supervision Report 10-25-2022
Received and Filed:  SPD Order Appointing Counsel.

Defendant Rozerricka N Ruffin in court.  Attorney Maryann Corea in court for Rozerricka N Ruffin.  Attorney Grace M. Gall in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for pretrial conference.  Attorney Corea informs the Court that there has been a breakdown in communication that is irreconcilable.  Motion of the defense counsel to withdraw granted by the Court.   Case is adjourned for status of counsel to Branch 40.
Status conference scheduled for October 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
records.descr: Motion and order for withdrawal of counsel

records.addlTxt: Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Supervision Report 10-03-2022

HELD OFF THE RECORD
Defendant Rozerricka N Ruffin in court with attorney Maryann Corea in person. 
Case set for status following case #22CF3118. Matter adjourned to Br. 40.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision Report 08-16-22
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Rozerricka N Ruffin in court with attorney Theodore OReilly.  Defendant Rozerricka N Ruffin in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Rozerricka N Ruffin appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Shelton, Branch 40.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.   This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Status conference scheduled for August 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
